patterns: What is the need of Automation and Orchestration
Why do we need automation
what are the advantages of automation
what are benefits of automation
responses: Automation and Orchestration are employed to deliver the business goals of increasing QUALITY, PACE and PRODUCTIVITY. By automation and orchestration we can ensure the repeat-ability of processes ensuring that quality is consistent. It also frees up people from doing low value tasks to be able to spend their time of high-value delivery. It also improves the efficiency of process so that the process lifecycle is shorter

patterns: Languages focused by wordline
what technical language do we use for our development
which language do we develop software
what is our preferred language of development
Which language do we write code in
Are there any guidelines for choosing language of development
responses: One of the key debates that has raged since Worldline was IPO'd from Atos has been development languages and specifically which we focus on. Worldline on a global basis is focused on Java with the majority of the tooling, skills and expertise focused on Java. The UK is and always has been much different with more solutions in .Net flavours than Java and plenty of VB and other older technologies still in place. so whilst the answer is simple that we have to accommodate both .Net and Java and also focus on emerging languages such as Scala development isn't just limited to core business logic languages. Therefore the strategy takes into account the need to focus on languages for presentation, mobile, automation and data science.
